    • Constructor Detail

      • Crypting

        public Crypting()

    • Method Detail

      • generateKey

        public static BufferedImage generateKey(int width,
                        int height)
        Securely generates a new Key
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the largest encryptable Image (width of key is two times as wide)
        height - The height of the largest encryptable Image (height of key is two times as tall)
        Returns:
        The key as a BufferedImage

      • loadAndCheckEncrFile

        public static BufferedImage loadAndCheckEncrFile(File keyFile)
        Loads a key or encrypted file in Image and checks it (roughly). It is assumed that the file is a png
        Parameters:
        keyFile -
        Returns:
        The key file as an image or null if it isn't a key file. Any white pixels the image might have had are converted to transparent ones.

      • loadAndCheckSource

        public static BufferedImage loadAndCheckSource(File sourceFile,
                               int width,
                               int height,
                               boolean resize)
        Loads the image to be encrypted. If the image is smaller than the maximum possible size and resize is true, it is resized. Also checks if the image is a valid source file (only black and white (or transparent) pixels). It is assumed that the file is a png.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - The image to be encrypted
        width - The width of the key to be used / 2
        height - The height of the key to be used / 2
        resize - true if image should be resized
        Returns:
        The (resized) image if it was OK or null. Any white pixels the image might have had are converted to transparent ones.

      • encryptImage

        public static BufferedImage encryptImage(BufferedImage imgKey,
                         BufferedImage imgSrc)
        Encrypts an image. It is assumed that the source image is the maximum possible size (width and height half of that of the key). Validity of source and key image are not checked, see loadAndCheckKey and loadAndCheckSource for that.
        Parameters:
        imgKey - The key to be used for the encryption
        imgSrc - The image to be encrypted
        Returns:
        The encrypted image or null if an error occured

      • overlayImages

        public static BufferedImage overlayImages(BufferedImage imgKey,
                          BufferedImage imgEnc)
        Generates an overlay of the key and the encrypted file, therefore producing an unclean, but Human readable decryption
        Parameters:
        imgKey - The key file used to encrypt the image
        imgEnc - The encrypted image
        Returns:
        The overlay or null if the images are of different size

      • decryptImage

        public static BufferedImage decryptImage(BufferedImage imgKey,
                         BufferedImage imgEnc)
        Decrypts an encrypted image
        Parameters:
        imgKey - The key file used to encrypt the image
        imgEnc - The encrypted image
        Returns:
        The decrypted picture

      • decryptImage

        public static BufferedImage decryptImage(BufferedImage imgOverlay)
        Decrypts an encrypted image (cleans up the provided overlay)
        Parameters:
        imgOverlay - An overlay generated by overlayImages()
        Returns:
        The decrypted picture
